trans-unit.source: Represents the description of a message.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription> contains the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Headers%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Body%2A> properties to provide get access to these parts of the message.
Whether the message is incoming or outgoing is indicated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Direction%2A> property.
It also provides an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Action%2A> property where the URI that indicates the intension of the message may be specified.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription"></xref> class with a specified action and direction.
The action parameter of the SOAP message that identifies the intent of the message.

<xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Input"></xref> if the message is incoming or <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Output"></xref> if the message is outgoing.
The direction is neither or .
Gets or sets the action parameter of the SOAP message that identifies the intent of the message.
This optional parameter can be used to specify the URI that identifies the intent of the message.
In SOAP 1.2, it serves a similar purpose as the SOAPAction HTTP header field did in SOAP 1.1.
The value of the action parameter is an absolute URI reference as defined by RFC 2396.
The SOAP 1.2 specification does not require that the URI be resolvable.
The URI should be globally unique and stable over time.
Servers, such as firewalls, can use the presence and content of the action parameter to filter SOAP messages and to facilitate the dispatch of SOAP messages to internal message handlers.
It should not be used as an insecure form of access authorization.
Use of the action parameter is optional.
SOAP receivers can use it as a hint to optimize processing, but must not require its presence to operate.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the action URI.
Gets the body of the SOAP message.
A SOAP body provides a mechanism for transmitting information to an ultimate SOAP receiver.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessagePartDescriptionCollection"></xref> that contains the body of the message.
Gets the direction that indicates whether the message is incoming or outgoing.
Incoming means that the message is coming from the client to the server.
This is the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Input> direction.
Outgoing means the message is coming from the server to the client.
This is the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Output> direction.

These terms can be confusing from the client perspective where the messages marked as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Input> are actually being sent and the messages marked as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Output> are being received.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection"></xref> that indicates whether the message is incoming to or outgoing from the service.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> has been set.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> has been set; otherwise `false`.
Gets the description of the headers of the SOAP message.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageHeaderDescriptionCollection"></xref> that contains descriptions of the headers of the SOAP message.
Gets or sets a type that identifies the type of message contract.
The message type can be `null`.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that identifies the type of message contract.
Gets a description of the properties of the SOAP message.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessagePropertyDescriptionCollection"></xref> that contains the descriptions of the properties of the SOAP message.
Gets or sets the security services required for the message.
The security services are used to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and authentication of the data contained in the message.
The value of <xref href="System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel"></xref> that specified the security services required for the message.
The value set is not valid value for <xref href="System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel"></xref>.

Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.ProtectionLevel"></xref> property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
